@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2004-2008 1&1 Internet AG, Germany, http://www.1und1.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. @description.name: @description
@description.body: The radio group handles a collection of items from which only one item can be selected. Selection another item will deselect the previously selected item. This class is e.g. used to create radio groups or {@link qx.ui.form.RadioButton} or {@link qx.ui.toolbar.RadioButton} instances. We also offer a widget for the same purpose which uses this class. So if you like to act with a widget instead of a pure logic coupling of the widgets, take a look at the {@link qx.ui.form.RadioButtonGroup} widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {qx.core.Object} A variable number of items, which are
     initially added to the radio group, the first item will be selected.
@param.description:
A variable number of items, which are
     initially added to the radio group, the first item will be selected.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The property name in each of the added widgets that is grouped

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The property name in each of the added widgets that is informed of the RadioGroup object it is a member of

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the radio group is enabled

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the selection should wrap around. This means that the successor of the last item is the first item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: If is set to true the selection could be empty, otherwise is always one RadioButton selected.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Flag signaling if the group at all is valid. All children will have the same state.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Flag signaling if the group is required.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Message which is shown in an invalid tooltip.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Message which is shown in an invalid tooltip if the {@link #required} is set to true.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {qx.ui.form.IRadioItem[]} The items of the radio group

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get all managed items

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.form.IRadioItem[]} All managed items.
@return.description: All managed items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add the passed items to the radio group.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {qx.ui.form.IRadioItem} A variable number of items to add.
@param.description: A variable number of items to add.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove an item from the radio group.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: item {qx.ui.form.IRadioItem} The item to remove.
@param.description: The item to remove.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array containing the group's items.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.form.IRadioItem[]} The item array
@return.description: The item array

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event listener for changeValue event of every managed item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Data} Data event
@param.description: Data event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Select the item following the given item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Select the item previous the given item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the items for the selection.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.form.IRadioItem[]} Items to select.
@return.description: Items to select.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns if the selection could be empty or not.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true If selection could be empty, false otherwise.
@return.description: true If selection could be empty, false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns whether the item is selectable. In opposite to the default implementation (which checks for visible items) every radio button which is part of the group is selected even if it is currently not visible.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: item {qx.ui.form.IRadioItem} The item to check if its selectable.
@param.description: The item to check if its selectable.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the item is part of the radio group false otherwise.
@return.description: true if the item is part of the radio group false otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for changeSelection.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Data} Data event.
@param.description: Data event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of currently selected items. Note: The result is only a set of selected items, so the order can differ from the sequence in which the items were added.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget[]} List of items.
@return.description: List of items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Replaces current selection with the given items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: items {qx.ui.core.Widget[]} Items to select.
@param.description: Items to select.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if the item is not a child element.
@throws.description: if the item is not a child element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Detects whether the given item is currently selected.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: item {qx.ui.core.Widget} Any valid selectable item
@param.description: Any valid selectable item

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the item is selected.
@return.description: Whether the item is selected.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if the item is not a child element.
@throws.description: if the item is not a child element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the selection is empty.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the selection is empty.
@return.description: Whether the selection is empty.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all elements which are selectable.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
all {Boolean} true for all selectables, false for the
   selectables the user can interactively select
@param.description:
true for all selectables, false for the
   selectables the user can interactively select

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget[]} The contained items.
@return.description: The contained items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the field model value. Should also update the UI.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var|null} Updates the field with the new model value.
@param.description: Updates the field with the new model value.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{null|Error} Should return an error when the type of
  model value is not compatible with the implementing class (the concrete field).
@return.description:
Should return an error when the type of
  model value is not compatible with the implementing class (the concrete field).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a consistent and up-to-date model value. Note: returned value can also be a promise of type Promise<*|null>.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var|null} The model value plain or as promise.
@return.description: The model value plain or as promise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property enabled. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #enabled}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property enabled. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #enabled}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property required. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #required}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property required. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #required}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property valid. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #valid}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property valid. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #valid}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property invalidMessage. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #invalidMessage}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property invalidMessage. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #invalidMessage}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property requiredInvalidMessage. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #requiredInvalidMessage}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property requiredInvalidMessage. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #requiredInvalidMessage}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Tries to set the selection using the given array containing the representative models for the selectables.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Array} An array of models.
@param.description: An array of models.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of the selected models.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array containing the models of the currently selected
   items.
@return.description:
An array containing the models of the currently selected
   items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event listener for changeSelected event on single selection manager.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Data} Data event.
@param.description: Data event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the selection manager if it is already exists, otherwise creates the manager.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.SingleSelectionManager} Single selection manager.
@return.description: Single selection manager.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The bind method delegates the call to the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
   the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
   the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
   be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
   be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map?null} A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{var} Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
   for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
   id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.description:
Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
   for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
   id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).
@throws.description:
If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The bind method delegates the call to the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
   the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
   the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
   be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
   be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map} A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} A promise which is resolved when the initial value
 	 has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
   values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
   The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
   an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.description:
A promise which is resolved when the initial value
 	 has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
   values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
   The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
   an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).
@throws.description:
If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes the binding with the given id from the current object. The id has to be the id returned by any of the bind functions.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {var} The id of the binding.
@param.description: The id of the binding.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the binding could not be found.
@throws.description: If the binding could not be found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings between the object and the related one.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
relatedObject {qx.core.Object} The object of which related
   bindings should be removed.
@param.description:
The object of which related
   bindings should be removed.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.
@throws.description:
If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array which lists all bindings for the object.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array of binding informations. Every binding
   information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
   targetObject and targetProperty in that order.
@return.description:
An array of binding informations. Every binding
   information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
   targetObject and targetProperty in that order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a debug message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.body: Logs an info message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a warning message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message with the current stack trace

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper that calls the appropriate logger function with the current object and any number of items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: level {String} The log level of the message
@param.description: The log level of the message

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {arguments} Arguments list to be logged
@param.description: Arguments list to be logged

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object, which is only called once. After the listener is called the event listener gets removed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object ? window} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove event listener from this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: self {Object ? null} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to remove the event listener of
   the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to remove the event listener of
   the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an event listener from an event target by an id returned by {@link #addListener}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id returned by {@link #addListener}
@param.description: The id returned by {@link #addListener}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check if there are one or more listeners for an event type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the object has a listener of the given type.
@return.description: Whether the object has a listener of the given type.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispatch an event on this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: evt {qx.event.type.Event} event to dispatch
@param.description: event to dispatch

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create an event object and dispatch it on this object. The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)
@param.description: The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets multiple properties at once by using a property list or sets one property and its value by the first and second argument. As a fallback, if no generated property setter could be found, a handwritten setter will be searched and invoked if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Map | String} a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.
@param.description: a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var?} the value, only used when data is a string.
@param.description: the value, only used when data is a string.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object} Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.
@return.description: Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the value of the given property. If no generated getter could be found, a fallback tries to access a handwritten getter.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The value of the value
@return.description: The value of the value

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the value of the given property. If no generated resetter could be found, a handwritten resetter will be invoked, if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the property is initialized, i.e. has a defined init value or has got a value by a setter method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property
@param.description: Name of the property

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} If the property is initialized
@return.description: If the property is initialized

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the property defined does not exist
@throws.description: If the property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the object with the specified ID

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
id
          {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the found object
@return.description: the found object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the object and adds it to a list; most classes are expected to override _createQxObjectImpl NOT this method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the created object
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the object, intended to be overridden. Null is a valid return value and will be cached by getQxObject, however undefined is NOT a valid value and so will not be cached meaning that _createQxObjectImpl will be called multiple times until a valid value is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the created object
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds an object as owned by this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {qx.core.Object} the object to register
@param.description: the object to register

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String?} the id to set when registering the object
@param.description: the id to set when registering the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Discards an object from the list of owned objects; note that this does not dispose of the object, simply forgets it if it exists.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: args {String|Object} the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself
@param.description: the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an owned object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {qx.core.Object} the object
@param.description: the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of objects that are owned by this object, or an empty array if none exists.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowEmptySelection}.
